title: Hotdog-Sandwich Taxonomy Framework

prerequisites: Secure buy-in from key stakeholder groups
steps.outcome: Create an authoritative body to define taxonomic standards
risks: Difficulty gaining consensus on commission composition
Potential for commission rulings to be ignored or challenged

prerequisites: Commission has defined membership and operating procedures
steps.outcome: Establish a framework that recognizes both structural and cultural classification criteria
risks: Resistance from purists on both sides
Difficulty translating hybrid model into clear, practical guidelines

steps.action: Implement Flexible Labeling and Dual-Classification Standards
prerequisites: Hybrid taxonomic model is defined and approved
Regulations and industry standards are updated
steps.outcome: Allow for multiple valid classification options on menus, packaging, and regulations
risks: Potential consumer confusion from ambiguous labeling
Resistance from stakeholders seeking clear, universal definitions

prerequisites: Taxonomic framework and dual-classification standards are established
steps.outcome: Increase public understanding and acceptance of the hybrid model
risks: Difficulty overcoming entrenched views and biases
Potential for continued debate and controversy

prerequisites: Regulatory bodies have adopted the hybrid taxonomy
steps.outcome: Create formal processes for stakeholders to resolve classification disputes
risks: Resistance to third-party mediation and arbitration
Potential for rulings to be ignored or challenged

resource_requirements: Diverse representation on Hotdog-Sandwich Classification Commission
Funding for public education campaign and conflict resolution infrastructure
Cooperation from regulatory bodies and industry associations
